title: These Pics Of Australia Rallying For The Climate Strike Will Warm Your Cold, Dead Heart
text:
Thanks for signing up!

In support of the Global Climate Strike – a week of action to demand climate justice, from September 20 to 27 – Pedestrian Group is doubling down on content that educates and empowers you to do your bit for our planet. Click here to learn more about the global movement fighting for our future.

Australia, you bloody legends. You took the Global Climate Strike and you ran with it so hard, it’s shocked us all.

With cities like Melbs, Sydney, Brissie and Hobart copping some major attention for huuuuge crowds, that doesn’t mean the rest of our Great Southern Land didn’t show the fuck up too. In fact, there are some pretty heartwarming images out there of crowds descending on everywhere from Geelong to Byron Bay.

All up, the numbers right now according to SMH are around 300,000+ and climbing, across eight major cities and over 100 towns. The biggest turnout Australia-wide since the protest against the Iraq War in 2003, which saw 500k.

At Geelong City Hall for the #ClimateStrike . Huge turnout pic.twitter.com/AA5Pbdo151 — Asher Moses (@ashermoses) September 20, 2019

Perth had some mega numbers, by the way.

This is the by far the biggest turnout for the climate that Perth has ever seen! #wapol #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/QVvTz8HK50 — Clean State (@CleanStateWA) September 20, 2019

And you Adelaideans (even though you are the cursed city, I will not take it back but also this is an All Aussie Mystery Hour joke) did DAMN GOOD SON.

YIEWWWWW NEWY!

Canberra! You’re full of the pollies and you totally showed up!!

Proud to join with a global movement in Canberra today calling for greater climate action #ClimateStrike #ClimateEmergency pic.twitter.com/vOlBfj8xcq — James Connolly (@jamesrobertcon1) September 20, 2019

Here’s some more bangers for you.

Coffs Harbour #ClimateStrike makes this old tree hugger happy. Our kids are alright ???? pic.twitter.com/coMycfwyOr — ????Fabulous Queen Maeve???? (@Psycho_Chook) September 20, 2019

Video from Esther Plummer (13) of the Byron Bay #climatestrike pic.twitter.com/ettK3Ms785 — Naaman Zhou (@naamanzhou) September 20, 2019

Actually more than 500 more like 750 at #wagga #ClimateStrike stretches four blocks of Baylis st politely waits for lights pic.twitter.com/tCdSvCatMy — Willow A (@WillowA2) September 20, 2019

Albany WA – its first public gathering of people/kids concerned about climate change #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/MZES9sFACN — Alan Dowsett (@Algus3) September 20, 2019

Bloody gorgeous stuff, Australia. Here’s hoping our united front moves a few of these goddamn mountains, huh.
description: Over 500,000 have reportedly shown up for the Global Climate Strike around Australia, with towns like Byron Bay, Geelong and Cairns taking part.
